item.title: Bill add a quote by Julian of Norwich
item.description: "All shall be well, and all shall be well and all manner of thing shall be well." -- Julian of Norwich

item.title: Bill add a quote by Samuel Johnson
item.description: "It is better to suffer wrong than to do it, and happier to be sometimes cheated than not to trust." -- Samuel Johnson

item.title: Bill add a quote by Graham Greene
item.description: "When we are not sure, we are alive." -- Graham Greene

item.title: Bill add a quote by Kabir
item.description: "If you don't break your ropes while you're alive, do you think ghosts will do it after?" -- Kabir

item.title: Bill add a quote by Mother Jones
item.description: "Pray for the dead and fight like hell for the living." -- Mother Jones

item.title: Bill add a quote by Emil Cioran
item.description: "Chaos is rejecting all you have learned, Chaos is being yourself." -- Emil Cioran

item.title: Bill add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "Let the beauty we love be what we do. There are hundreds of ways to kneel and kiss the ground." -- Rumi

item.title: Bill add a quote by Thich Nhat Hanh
item.description: "If you touch one thing with deep awareness, you touch everything." -- Thich Nhat Hanh

item.title: Bill add a quote by W.B. Yeats
item.description: "What can be explained is not poetry." -- W.B. Yeats

item.title: Bill add a quote by Eugene V. Debs
item.description: "Intelligent discontent is the mainspring of civilization." -- Eugene V. Debs

item.title: Bill add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "One must still have chaos in oneself to be able to give birth to a dancing star." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Bill add a quote by St. Teresa of Avila
item.description: "It is foolish to think that we will enter heaven without entering into ourselves." -- St. Teresa of Avila

item.title: Bill add a quote by T. S. Eliot
item.description: "Humankind cannot bear very much reality." -- T. S. Eliot

item.title: Bill add a quote by Eugene V. Debs
item.description: "While there is a lower class, I am in it, while there is a criminal element, I am of it, and while there is a soul in prison, I am not free." -- Eugene V. Debs

item.title: Bill add a quote by Howard Zinn
item.description: "Small acts, when multiplied by millions of people, can transform the world." -- Howard Zinn

item.title: Bill add a quote by Upton Sinclair
item.description: "It is difficult to get a man to understand something, when his salary depends on his not understanding it." -- Upton Sinclair

item.title: Bill add a quote by Randall Jarell
item.description: "A poet is a man who manages, in a lifetime of standing out in thunderstorms, to be struck by lightning five or six times." -- Randall Jarell

item.title: Bill add a quote by Samuel Taylor Coleridge
item.description: "Poetry: the best words in the best order." -- Samuel Taylor Coleridge

item.title: Bill add a quote by Samuel Johnson
item.description: "What is written without effort is in general read without pleasure." -- Samuel Johnson

item.title: Bill add a quote by Howard Zinn
item.description: "But I suppose the most revolutionary act one can engage in is... to tell the truth." -- Howard Zinn

item.title: Bill add a quote by Emil Cioran
item.description: "In every man sleeps a prophet, and when he wakes there is a little more evil in the world." -- Emil Cioran

item.title: Bill add a quote by Samuel Johnson
item.description: "A man ought to read just as inclination leads him; for what he reads as a task will do him little good." -- Samuel Johnson

item.title: Bill add a quote by Emil Cioran
item.description: "Write books only if you are going to say in them the things you would never dare confide to anyone." -- Emil Cioran

item.title: Bill add a quote by Nietzsche
item.description: "Insanity in individuals is something rare- but in groups, parties, nations and epochs, it is the rule." -- Nietzsche

item.title: Bill add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Christianity gave Eros poison to drink; he did not die of it, certainly, but degenerated to Vice." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Bill add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "The breeze at dawn has secrets to tell you. Don't go back to sleep." -- Rumi

item.title: Bill add a quote by Santa Teresa de Jesús
item.description: "I am quite sure I am more afraid of people who are themselves terrified of the devil than I am of the devil himself." -- Santa Teresa de Jesús

item.title: Bill add a quote by François Rabelais
item.description: "I go to seek a Great Perhaps." -- François Rabelais

item.title: Bill add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "I do not understand the mystery of grace -- only that it meets us where we are and does not leave us where it found us." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: Bill add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "Forgiveness is giving up all hope of having had a better past." -- Anne Lamott
